intro: Polygonum aequale subvar. parvulum, commonly known as dwarf knotweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a slightly hairy surface. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which appear in late summer. This plant is often found in moist or wet habitats such as marshes, streambanks, and wet meadows.
